name: Forbidden City
description: The imperial palace complex of the Ming and Qing dynasties, showcasing traditional Chinese architecture and history.

name: St. Peter's Basilica
description: The world’s largest church and a Renaissance masterpiece, serving as a spiritual center of Catholicism.

name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
description: A Gothic architectural gem on the Île de la Cité, famed for its stained glass, towers, and cultural heritage.

name: Louvre Museum
description: The world’s largest and most visited art museum, home to masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and Venus de Milo.

name: Lincoln Memorial
description: A national monument honoring Abraham Lincoln, symbolizing unity, freedom, and American ideals.

name: Colosseum (and Circuit)
description: An ancient Roman amphitheater, famous for gladiatorial contests and its enduring symbol of Imperial Rome.

name: Acropolis (Parthenon)
description: A UNESCO site and ancient citadel featuring the Parthenon, a temple dedicated to the goddess Athena.

name: Eiffel Tower
description: The iron lattice tower and global symbol of France, originally built for the 1889 World’s Fair.

name: Hagia Sophia
description: A masterpiece of Byzantine architecture, serving as a cathedral, mosque, and now a mosque-museum hybrid.

name: Taj Mahal
description: A UNESCO World Heritage mausoleum built by Emperor Shah Jahan, celebrated as a symbol of eternal love.

name: Cologne Cathedral
description: A Gothic masterpiece and Germany’s most visited landmark, housing the Shrine of the Three Kings.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: An architectural icon on Sydney Harbour, famous for its sail-like design and cultural performances.

name: Great Wall of China
description: A massive fortification stretching thousands of kilometers, symbolizing China’s strength and resilience.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: A gift from France, this colossal statue is a universal symbol of freedom and democracy.

name: Sagrada Família
description: Antoni Gaudí’s unfinished basilica, a blend of Gothic and Art Nouveau, and an emblem of Barcelona.

name: Alhambra
description: A Moorish palace and fortress complex, known for its intricate Islamic architecture and gardens.

name: Pyramids of Giza
description: The last of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, built as monumental tombs for pharaohs.

name: Machu Picchu
description: A breathtaking Incan citadel in the Andes, often called the Lost City of the Incas.

name: Angkor Wat
description: The largest religious monument in the world, originally built as a Hindu temple in the 12th century.

name: Petra
description: An ancient Nabataean city carved into rose-red rock, often called the ‘Rose City’ and a UNESCO site.

name: British Museum
description: One of the world’s most comprehensive museums, showcasing human history, art, and culture with collections spanning over two million years.

name: Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: The largest art museum in the Americas, renowned for its vast collection from ancient times to modern art.

name: Versailles Palace
description: A grand French royal residence famous for its Hall of Mirrors, gardens, and role in European history.

name: Christ the Redeemer
description: An iconic Art Deco statue of Jesus Christ overlooking Rio, symbolizing peace and Brazilian culture.

name: Pompeii Archaeological Site
description: Ancient Roman city preserved under volcanic ash from Mount Vesuvius, offering a vivid snapshot of life nearly 2,000 years ago.

name: Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum
description: Part of the Smithsonian Institution, showcasing historic aircraft, spacecraft, and achievements in aviation and space exploration.

name: Pantheon
description: A remarkably preserved ancient Roman temple, now a church, known for its massive dome and central oculus.

name: Tower of London
description: Historic fortress on the River Thames, once a royal palace and prison, today home to the Crown Jewels.

name: Golden Gate Bridge
description: An engineering marvel and symbol of San Francisco, famous for its Art Deco design and striking orange-red color.

name: Disneyland Park (Anaheim)
description: The original Disney theme park, opened in 1955, combining fairy-tale attractions and modern entertainment.

name: Disney World (Magic Kingdom)
description: The most visited theme park in the world, famous for Cinderella Castle and Disney’s magical attractions.

name: Tokyo Disneyland
description: A Japanese Disney resort blending classic attractions with unique cultural touches, beloved by families worldwide.

name: Tokyo DisneySea
description: Themed around ocean exploration, this park is unique to Japan and known for immersive storytelling and design.

name: Universal Studios Japan
description: A theme park featuring popular attractions like Harry Potter, Minions, and Super Nintendo World.

name: Universal Studios Florida
description: Part of the Universal Orlando Resort, known for movie-themed rides and attractions like Harry Potter and Jurassic Park.

name: Disney California Adventure
description: A Disney theme park inspired by California’s culture and history, home to Pixar Pier and Avengers Campus.

name: Ocean Park
description: A marine mammal park, oceanarium, and amusement park that combines education, conservation, and entertainment.

name: Shanghai Disneyland
description: Disney’s first theme park in mainland China, featuring the largest Disney castle in the world.

name: Universal Studios Hollywood
description: A film studio and theme park offering rides, attractions, and behind-the-scenes tours of movie sets.

name: Epcot (Disney World)
description: Part of Walt Disney World, focusing on technological innovation, science, and cultural showcases from around the world.

name: Animal Kingdom (Disney World)
description: A Disney theme park combining wildlife conservation with attractions like Pandora – The World of Avatar.

name: Hollywood Studios (Disney World)
description: A Disney park dedicated to movies and TV, home to Star Wars: Galaxy’s Edge and Toy Story Land.

name: Hong Kong Disneyland
description: Disney’s first park in China, blending traditional Disney attractions with Asian cultural elements.

name: Chichen Itza
description: An ancient Mayan city and UNESCO site, famous for the Temple of Kukulcán pyramid.

name: Grand Canyon National Park
description: A natural wonder carved by the Colorado River, known for its vast landscapes and breathtaking views.

name: Niagara Falls
description: One of the world’s most famous waterfalls, straddling the US–Canada border with massive tourist appeal.

name: Banff National Park
description: Canada’s oldest national park, renowned for its turquoise lakes, mountain scenery, and outdoor recreation.

name: Times Square
description: The bustling heart of Manhattan, known for its neon lights, Broadway theaters, and New Year’s Eve celebrations.

name: Las Vegas Strip
description: A stretch of Las Vegas Boulevard famous for its casinos, hotels, and nightlife entertainment.

name: Meiji Shrine
description: A Shinto shrine dedicated to Emperor Meiji and Empress Shoken, surrounded by a peaceful forest in central Tokyo.
